paragraphs.text:
%md ## Welcome to the GeoWave GPX KMeans Example (EMR Version). ##### This is a live note - you can run the code yourself. ### Setup

The only prerequisite to running this example is increasing your shell interpreter's timeout.
Go to the Interpreter page, and scroll down to the 'sh' section. Click on the 'edit' button.

Set the 'shell.command.timeout.millisecs' entry to 600000 (10 minutes).

### Execution

The list of paragraphs below needs to be run sequentially.
Start at the top, and click the play button in each paragraph, waiting for completion.
Each paragraph is labeled and commented so you can tell what's happening. A paragraph will be marked
with a FINISHED indicator next to the play button when it has run without error.

Enjoy!

msg.data:
Welcome to the GeoWave GPX KMeans Example (EMR Version).

This is a live note - you can run the code yourself.

Setup

The only prerequisite to running this example is increasing your shell interpreter's timeout.
Go to the Interpreter page, and scroll down to the 'sh' section. Click on the 'edit' button.

Set the 'shell.command.timeout.millisecs' entry to 600000 (10 minutes).

Execution

The list of paragraphs below needs to be run sequentially.
Start at the top, and click the play button in each paragraph, waiting for completion.
Each paragraph is labeled and commented so you can tell what's happening. A paragraph will be marked
with a FINISHED indicator next to the play button when it has run without error.

Enjoy!

paragraphs.title: Import GPX Data
paragraphs.text:
%sh
s3-dist-cp --src=s3://geowave-gpx-data/gpx --dest=hdfs://$HOSTNAME:8020/tmp/

/opt/accumulo/bin/accumulo shell -u root -p secret -e "importtable geowave.germany_gpx_SPATIAL_IDX /tmp/spatial"
/opt/accumulo/bin/accumulo shell -u root -p secret -e "importtable geowave.germany_gpx_GEOWAVE_METADATA /tmp/metadata"

paragraphs.title: Configure GeoWave
paragraphs.text:
%sh
# clear out potential old runs
geowave config rmstore kmeans_hbase
geowave config rmstore germany_gpx_accumulo

# configure geowave connection params for name stores "germany_gpx_accumulo" and "kmeans_hbase"
geowave config addstore germany_gpx_accumulo --gwNamespace geowave.germany_gpx -t accumulo --zookeeper $HOSTNAME:2181 --instance accumulo --user root --password secret
geowave config addstore kmeans_hbase --gwNamespace geowave.kmeans -t hbase --zookeeper $HOSTNAME:2181

# set up geoserver
geowave config geoserver "$HOSTNAME:8000"

# add gpx layer
geowave gs addlayer germany_gpx_accumulo -id gpxpoint
wget s3.amazonaws.com/geowave/latest/scripts/emr/quickstart/SubsamplePoints.sld
geowave gs addstyle SubsamplePoints -sld SubsamplePoints.sld
geowave gs setls gpxpoint --styleName SubsamplePoints

paragraphs.text:
%spark
//Import classes from spark
import org.apache.spark.api.java.JavaSparkContext
//DataFrame = type alias Dataset<Row>
import org.apache.spark.sql.DataFrame
import spark.implicits._

//Import classes from geowave
import mil.nga.giat.geowave.datastore.hbase.operations.config.HBaseRequiredOptions
import mil.nga.giat.geowave.datastore.accumulo.operations.config.AccumuloRequiredOptions
import mil.nga.giat.geowave.analytic.spark.kmeans.KMeansRunner
import mil.nga.giat.geowave.core.store.query.QueryOptions
import mil.nga.giat.geowave.analytic.spark.GeoWaveRDD
import mil.nga.giat.geowave.analytic.spark.sparksql.SimpleFeatureDataFrame
import mil.nga.giat.geowave.core.index.ByteArrayId

msg.data:
import org.apache.spark.api.java.JavaSparkContext
import org.apache.spark.sql.DataFrame
import spark.implicits._
import mil.nga.giat.geowave.datastore.hbase.operations.config.HBaseRequiredOptions
import mil.nga.giat.geowave.datastore.accumulo.operations.config.AccumuloRequiredOptions
import mil.nga.giat.geowave.analytic.spark.kmeans.KMeansRunner
import mil.nga.giat.geowave.core.store.query.QueryOptions
import mil.nga.giat.geowave.analytic.spark.GeoWaveRDD
import mil.nga.giat.geowave.analytic.spark.sparksql.SimpleFeatureDataFrame
import mil.nga.giat.geowave.core.index.ByteArrayId

paragraphs.text:
%spark

//Grab hostname from environment vars
val hostname = environmentVars.getOrElse("HOSTNAME", "invalid-host")
println(s"hostname= $hostname")

//Setup datastores
val input_store = new AccumuloRequiredOptions()
input_store.setInstance("accumulo")
input_store.setUser("root")
input_store.setPassword("secret")
input_store.setZookeeper(hostname + ":2181")
input_store.setGeowaveNamespace("geowave.germany_gpx")

val output_store = new HBaseRequiredOptions()
output_store.setZookeeper(hostname + ":2181")
output_store.setGeowaveNamespace("geowave.kmeans")

//Create instances of store plugin options, and KMeansRunner
val input_store_plugin = input_store.createPluginOptions()
val output_store_plugin = output_store.createPluginOptions()
val jsc = JavaSparkContext.fromSparkContext(sc)
val kmeans_runner = new KMeansRunner()

paragraphs.text:
%sh
#clear old potential runs
geowave remote clear kmeans_hbase

paragraphs.text:
%spark
//set the appropriate properties of the runner
kmeans_runner.setJavaSparkContext(JavaSparkContext.fromSparkContext(sc))
kmeans_runner.setAdapterId("gpxpoint")
kmeans_runner.setNumClusters(8)
kmeans_runner.setInputDataStore(input_store_plugin)
kmeans_runner.setOutputDataStore(output_store_plugin)
kmeans_runner.setCqlFilter("BBOX(geometry,  13.3, 52.45, 13.5, 52.5)")
kmeans_runner.setCentroidTypeName("mycentroids")
kmeans_runner.setHullTypeName("myhulls")
kmeans_runner.setGenerateHulls(true)
kmeans_runner.setComputeHullData(true)

//execute the kmeans runner
kmeans_runner.run()

paragraphs.title: Add KMeans Results to GeoServer
paragraphs.text:
%sh

# add the centroids layer
geowave gs addlayer kmeans_hbase -id mycentroids
geowave gs setls mycentroids --styleName point

# add the hulls layer
geowave gs addlayer kmeans_hbase -id myhulls
geowave gs setls myhulls --styleName line
